content: Fox's decision not to air President Obama's press conference Wednesday night sheds light on the behind-the-scenes process by which the major TV networks decide to preempt their regular programming at the president's request -- a decision which costs them millions of dollars. The conference, scheduled to air at 8 p.m. ET, will not just be held during prime time, but during the important sweeps period, costing the networks each millions of dollars in ad revenue. One source said Fox would lose $2 million to $3 million by airing the news conference instead of its regular programming. In 2000 Fox did not air a presidential debate and in 2001 it declined a request for airtime by President George W. Bush. ***So Libs can't say it was because it was Obama. They did it to Bush as well.*** Twice this year Fox has rescheduled "American Idol," the highest-rated program on television to make room for an Obama press conference. Wednesday's news conference will be Obama's third in prime time. At the current pace, he is on track to hold one a month. "http://abcnews.go.com/Business/IndustryInfo/Story?id=7451512&page=2" "A government big enough to give you everything you want, is strong enough to take everything you have." ~ Gerald Ford

They did it to Bush as well.*** Twice this year Fox has rescheduled "American Idol," the highest-rated program on television to make room for an Obama press conference. Wednesday's news conference will be Obama's third in prime time. At the current pace, he is on track to hold one a month. "http://abcnews.go.com/Business/IndustryInfo/Story?id=7451512&page=2" "A government big enough to give you everything you want, is strong enough to take everything you have." ~ Gerald Ford

content: quote: One source said Fox would lose $2 million to $3 million by airing the news conference instead of its regular programming. Im sure Fox still had more viewers than the other networks. Did he even say anything we havent already heard? Besides, His teleprompter had his whole speech online hours before so why even bother listening to Obama read it. I did see the excerpts on Foxnews channel and is it just me or does anyone else notice how he swaggers like he is God when he is approaching the podium? Kinda Pathetic to watch, all show and now substance. I thought the campaign was over but Iowa already has an office set up for 2012 elections

content: On one hand this press conference was a complete waste of time, just garbage. On the other, it is a clear sign of the ONLY capital this administration has: A popular President. The ONLY thing they are doing right is keeping President Obama popular, and therefore reassure the public that he is "on the job" and "getting things done"...."Trust us"
